title: Mandarin Oriental, Paris celebrates new artistic collaboration with French urban artist, Mambo
text:
Mandarin Oriental, Paris celebrates new artistic collaboration with French urban artist, Mambo Mandarin Oriental, Paris celebrates new artistic collaboration with French urban artist, Mambo Details Category: Hotel   15:15 Mandarin Oriental, Paris has announced its latest collaboration with French urban artist, Mambo. The artist will create a new visual identity for the hotel cake shop and exhibit specially commissioned paintings in the lobby from September. 
A self-taught artist, Mambo uses his own graphic language to illustrate the human psyche, with emotions, memories, dreams and inner feelings revealed through visual enigmas. Mandarin Oriental, Paris first collaborated with Mambo for its J’aime la Mode event in 2013 and then for a party in 2014, when he painted illustrations on lobby windows. The Mambo-redesigned Mandarin Cake Shop will come with limited edition pastry boxes, bags and cups created by the artist. In addition to pastries, cannelés and macarons, the cake shop, open daily from 7am to 8pm, will serve cakes specially made by pastry chef, Pierre Mathieu in collaboration with Mambo. In addition, guests will have an opportunity to view Mambo artworks specially painted for the hotel. The artist will exhibit four paintings at the hotel entrance, inspired by the colours, cool elegance and contemporary design of Mandarin Oriental, Paris. Related articles
